Instruction: Place a large pot of salted water over high heat and bring to a boil. Peel the russet potatoes and cut them into 1-inch cubes for even cooking.
Add the potato cubes to the boiling water and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until fork-tender. Drain the potatoes thoroughly.
While the potatoes are cooking, heat the milk and butter in a small saucepan over medium heat until the butter is melted and the milk is hot. Do not boil the milk.
In a large bowl, mash the cooked potatoes with a potato masher or a hand mixer until mostly smooth, leaving a few small chunks for texture.
Gradually add the hot milk mixture to the mashed potatoes, beating with an electric mixer on low speed until well combined and creamy. Alternatively, you can use a hand mixer or a large spoon.
Season the mashed potatoes with salt, black pepper, and garlic powder (if using) to taste. Beat until well combined.
Garnish with chopped chives (optional) and serve immediately.
